author: TravisEz13
body:
<!--

If you are running a released version of powershell, but not the latest one, install the latest from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases and try to repro it again

Before submitting this issue, please first:

- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- [X] If it is a bug, fill out this form:
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Enable-Pstrace -AnalyticOnly -Force
## Expected behavior

Command should work
## Actual behavior

The term 'Enable-Pstrace' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
## Environment data

Fails on nano and client SKU, but with different errors

<!-- If running the latest released version, specify the version, i.e. -->

v0.4.0

<!-- If running you own build, please fill in the results of the following commands: -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSVersion                      5.1.14361.1000
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSEdition                      Core
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
CLRVersion
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
BuildVersion                   10.0.14361.1000
```

`````` sh
$ dotnet --info
.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.0-preview2-003096)

Product Information:
 Version:            1.0.0-preview2-003096
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  191812690d

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.14353
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64


$ git rev-parse HEAD; git status
ebd28ec6651347e11a4efef492817565e6c6b49d
On branch master
Your branch is up-to-date with 'PowerShell/master'.
nothing to commit, working directory clean


```_

```_
``````

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @daxian-dbw I imagine this is to do with PSEvents?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Looks like it might not even be in Core PowerShell.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Enable-PSTrace is from the module 'PSDiagnostics'. The module files are already in 'src\powershell\Modules\PSDiagnostics', but the files need to be updated a bit to work in NanoServer. @Francisco-Gamino is currently working on that. Probably it can be brought in with the next migration from SD.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body:
Testing this on the latest versoin of PowerShell (7.2.1) does not give this error.

Can this issue be closed??

title: Disable/Enable-PSTrace missing
